meanings.definition: To follow closely behind another vehicle in order to take advantage of the reduced air resistance.
meanings.sent1: The cyclist slipstreamed behind the lead rider to conserve energy.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the cars slipstreamed one another to gain speed.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel slipstreamed behind the bigger squirrel to steal its acorn.
meanings.sent4: The student slipstreamed behind the teacher, absorbing all the knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship slipstreamed through the galaxy, moving swiftly and smoothly.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or include something seamlessly into a larger entity or process.
meanings.sent1: She slipstreamed her ideas into the presentation seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The chef slipstreamed the secret ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The spy slipstreamed into the enemy base without being noticed.
meanings.sent4: The artist slipstreamed emotions into the painting, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The melody slipstreamed into the song, enhancing its beauty.
